original: Colonial painting in Chile, as well as throughout Latin America, was significantly influenced by Spanish art. This influence encompassed various aspects, including the anatomical study of the human body, the chiaroscuro technique, and the depiction of subjects in aristocratic attire. The Spanish conquerors regarded craft and artisan work as demeaning and contrary to notions of nobility, leading them to delegate these tasks to mestizos a
